page.title: 01The East Dean Valley
page.content:
This is an area of outstanding beauty with two small villages nestling at the foot of the Downs. There are lovely woodlands and open downland with many footpaths leading to the South Down Way. The River Lavant runs through the Valley though it often dries up in the summer months.
Population East Dean 240 (1981 census) Charlton 100
The area includes :- Goodwood Race Course, A Caravan Park A church & a Chapel, A country Park Two Public Houses, A Nature Reserve Two Farms, One Hotel, A village hall A Garage with Petrol Filling Station, A Grocers with Post Office and Off Licence, Two Telephone kiosks, A Small industial Estate & Footpaths to the South Downs Way.
